get.description:
Return a list of batches. Each batch object represents a batch operation. The status of a batch can be "Queued" (waiting to be run), "Running" (currently being processed), and "Finished" (finished processing). When you run an operation in batch mode, it returns the ID of its batch which you can then fetch with a GET to poll for its status and obtain the results of the operation once it has completed.

Note that "Finished" does not necessarily mean that the operation was successful. You should check the status of the structures in the response_bodies attribute to see the status of each individual operation.

parameters.name: $after
parameters.description: Used for fast paging by setting the value to the last object id. This cannot be used with the $order parameter.

parameters.name: $count
parameters.description: If true, just return the number of list items in the form {'count' : number}.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter using JSON structure, with attributes taken from this list: id, user_id, status.

parameters.name: $include
parameters.description: Comma separated list of relationships to include in the results, taken from this list: user.

parameters.name: $limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of returned objects. The default is 10, the maximum is 100.

parameters.name: $offset
parameters.description: Used for paging through a small dataset, and it can be used with the $order parameter. This cannot be used with the $after parameter.

200.description: Here is the format of the response when the operation is a success.

post.description:
Create a user.

By default, a user is not notified that an account has been added for them. If you want them to receive a notification with login instructions, set the optional send_login_instructions option to true. If send_login_instructions is set to true, you can add an additional optional from_name true to send the instructions from that name. For example: POST /users?$options={"send_login_instructions": true}, Payload: {first_name: 'John', last_name: 'Smith', userid: 'jsmith', roles: 'Learner'}

parameters.name: $options
parameters.description: Valid options are: send_login_instructions, change_password, from_name, reply_to_email

requestBody.description: Here is the format of a request.

about.example: I'm Sally from Seattle, Washington, I graduated with a B.S. in Modern Arts from Arizona State University. From there, I moved to California to learn more about photography and film making.

added_by_id.description: The ID of the user who added this user

archived.description: Indicates if this user is archived

city.description: The city in the user's address

country.description: The country in the user's address

custom_fields.description: A structure representing custom fields that contains zero or more key: value pairs.

email_sync.description: How messages should be sync'ed to email. Must be one of: 'None', 'All', 'Digest'

first_name.description: The first name of the user

instructorID.description: An instructor ID, which is generally used externally to the learning platform

job_title_id.description: The ID of the user's job title

language.description: The language of the user

last_name.description: The last name of the user

learnerID.description: A learner ID, which is generally used externally to the learning platform

manager_id.description: The ID of the user's manager, if they have one

mobile_phone.description: The mobile phone number of the user

organization_id.description: The ID of the user's organization

phone.description: The phone number of the user

roles.description: The user's roles, which can be one or more of the following: Administrator, Affiliate, Instructor, Learner, Manager, Mentor, Monitor, Parent, Resource manager, and TA

sms_email.description: The email address used to send SMS messages

sms_sync.description: How messages should be sync'ed to SMS email. Must be one of: 'None', 'All'

state.description: The state in the user's address

street_1.description: The first street in the user's address

street_2.description: The second street in the user's address

street_3.description: The third street in the user's address

userid.description: The unique userid of the user

zip.description: The zip code in the user's address

201.description: Here is the format of the response when the operation is a success.

x-code-samples.label: Create a Single User
x-code-samples.source:
curl -X POST "https://your-portal-url.com/api/v3/users?api_key=YOUR_API_KEY&$options={\"send_login_instructions\": true}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-d '{
  "first_name": "John",
  "last_name": "Smith",
  "userid": "jsmith",
  "roles": ["Learner"],
  "email": "john.smith@example.com",
  "birthdate": "1990-01-01",
  "city": "Los Angeles",
  "country": "United States",
  "custom_fields": {
    "key 1": "value 1",
    "key 2": "value 2"
  },
  "archived": false
}'

Return a list of the players in the game with the specified ID. Note that this does not return user objects, it returns their player records that include the user_id. You can use $include=user if you want to get the user object as well.

Note also that the points field indicates the total number of points that the player currently has and their current level. There are additional methods for getting the history of the player's points, badges, and level achievements.

schema.title: Group
schema.description: A group can have admins, members, and assistants. If it's a team group then it can also have leaders. A group is used primarily for collaboration of various kinds.

description.example: A place where AI enthusiasts chat about this exciting new technology

display_in_catalog.description: Indicates if the group should be displayed in the group catalog

max_members.description: The maximum number of members that can be in the group; nil means that there is no maximum

language.description: The language associated with the resource.

private.description: Indicates if the group is private and needs an access code to join it

team.description: Indicate if the group is a team group

type.description: The type of the group, which can be null (the default) or one of 'Interest', 'Study', 'Club', 'Hobby', 'Faculty', or 'Students'.

get.description: Return a list of courses. By default, archived courses are not returned, and you can use the filter archived=true if you want to get a list of archived courses.

parameters.name: $after
parameters.description: Used for fast paging by setting the value to the last object id. This cannot be used with the $order parameter.

parameters.name: $count
parameters.description: If true, just return the number of list items in the form {'count' : number}.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter using JSON structure, with attributes taken from this list: archived (default: false), organization_id, id, name, course_code, sis_id, sis_pid, path, tags, metadata.creator_id, metadata.created_at, metadata.language.

parameters.name: $include
parameters.description: Comma separated list of relationships to include in the results, taken from this list: parent, current_module, organization.

parameters.name: $limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of returned objects. The default is 10, the maximum is 100.

parameters.name: $offset
parameters.description: Used for paging through a small dataset, and it can be used with the $order parameter. This cannot be used with the $after parameter.

parameters.name: $order
parameters.description: Comma separated attribute names to sort by, taken from this list: id, name. Add :desc to the end of an attribute name for descending order. This cannot be used with the $after parameter.

200.description: Here is the format of the response when the operation is a success.

post.description: Create a course.

requestBody.description: Here is the format of a request.

schema.title: Course
schema.description: A course is the primary vehicle of delivery of educational content. A course can have instructors, learners, and assistants.

allow_reenrollment.description: Indicates if learners can re-enroll into the course

allow_unenrollment.description: Indicates if learners can un-enroll from the course

archived.description: Indicates if the course is archived

auto_complete_on_visit.description: Indicates if an html section should be auto-completed when a learner visits it

auto_enroll_from_waitlist.description: Indicates if a learner on the waitlist should be automatically enrolled when a seat becomes available

credits.description: The number of credits earned upon course completion

custom_fields.description: A structure representing custom fields that contains zero or more key: value pairs

delete_history_on_unenroll.description: Indicates if the learner's history in the course should be deleted if they are unenrolled

display_in_catalog.description: Indicates if the course should appear in the course catalog

enrollment_open.description: Indicates if learners can currently enroll into the course

finish_at.description: When the course finishes (only applies to instructor-led and blended courses)

locked.description: Indicates if the course is locked

long_description.description: A long description of the course

max_seats.description: The maximum number of learners in the course, whether they are active or not

max_students.description: The maximum number of active learners in the course

language.description: The language associated with the resource.

must_repurchase_to_reenroll.description: Indicates if a learner must re-purchase the course in order to take it again

open_enrollment.description: Indicates if the course is public and allows enrollment from visitors

organization_id.description: The ID of the organization that the course belongs to

path.description: Indicates if the course is a learning path

picture.description: The URL of the course picture

price.description: The price of the course (when e-commerce is enabled)

private.description: Indicates if the course is private and needs an access code to join it

short_description.description: A short description of the course

sis_id.description: The unique SIS ID of the course

sis_pid.description: The unique SIS ID of the parent course

start_at.description: When the course starts (only applies to instructor-led and blended courses)

style.description: The style of course, which must be one of "Self paced", "Instructor", "Blended", or "Micro class"

tax_exempt.description: Indicates if the course is tax-exempt

time_zone.description: The time zone associated with the course

waitlist_after_limit.description: Indicates if an enrollment should automatically be placed onto the waitlist once the max-students limit has been reached

weight_using_categories.description: Indicates if assessments should be grouped by category when calculating weights

weights.description: The weighting setting, must be one of: 'MaxScore', 'Points', 'Percent', or 'Equally'

201.description: Here is the format of the response when the operation is a success.

x-code-samples.label: Creating a Single Course
x-code-samples.source:
curl -X POST "https://your-portal-url.com/api/v3/courses?api_key=YOUR_API_KEY" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-d '{
  "name": "Course Name",
  "style": "Instructor",
  "allow_reenrollment": true,
  "allow_unenrollment": true,
  "archived": false,
  "auto_complete_on_visit": true,
  "auto_enroll_from_waitlist": true,
  "course_code": "COURSE101",
  "custom_fields": {
    "key 1": "value 1",
    "key 2": "value 2"
  },
  "delete_history_on_unenroll": true,
  "disable_completion": true,
  "display_in_catalog": true,
  "enrollment_open": true,
  "finish_at": "2024-06-13",
  "tax_exempt": true,
  "time_zone": "string",
  "waitlist_after_limit": true,
  "weight_using_categories": true,
  "weights": "MaxScore"
}'

get.description:
Return a list of the course learners. Note that this does not return user objects, it returns their learner records that include the user_id. You can use $include=user if you want to get the user object as well. Learner records are not returned for users that are archived.

By default, this operation returns learners that are active, completed, or deactivated. It does not return learners that were unenrolled. You can use filters to return a specific set of learners based on their status. For example, /courses/ID/learners?$filter={"completed": true} will only return learners that have completed the course.

Learner records are lightweight and include only information about the learner's enrollment status. If you want additional progress information such as the learner's current score percent, grade, percent progress, mastery percent and mastery classification, you can use $include=progress to include the Learner progress record with each list item.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the course

parameters.name: $count

parameters.name: $filter

parameters.name: $include
parameters.description: Comma separated list of relationships to include in the results, taken from this list: user, course, progress, enrolled_by, unenrolled_by, deactivated_by, reactivated_by, transferred_by, transferred_from, transferred_to, order_item.

post.description:
Add a course learner.

By default, a user is not notified that they have been added as a learner to the course and you are not allowed to re-enroll existing students. If you want them to receive a notification, set the optional send_notification parameter to true.

The default behavior can be changed by passing these options:

  • send_notification (boolean): notify the user that they have been enrolled
  • reenroll (string):
    • never: default value, re-enrolling is not allowed
    • only_completed: allow re-enrolling students who have completed the course
    • always: allow re-enrolling of any student
  • increment_seats (boolean): if true and no seats are remaining in the course, an additional seat is added to the course before enrolling the student. If seats are available, no change is made to the maximum number of seats.

Add the options as a JSON object to the $options parameter.

For example: POST /courses/27/learners?$options={send_notification:true,reenroll:only_completed,"increment_seats":true}

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the course

parameters.name: $options
parameters.description: Valid options are: send_notification, reenroll, increment_seats

  • increment_seats (boolean): if true and no seats are remaining in the course, an additional seat is added to the course before enrolling the student. If seats are available, no change is made to the maximum number of seats.

Add the options as a JSON object to the $options parameter.

For example: POST /courses/27/learners?$options={send_notification:true,reenroll:only_completed,"increment_seats":true}

items.title: Course
items.description: A course is the primary vehicle of delivery of educational content. A course can have instructors, learners, and assistants.

allow_reenrollment.description: Indicates if learners can re-enroll into the course

allow_unenrollment.description: Indicates if learners can un-enroll from the course

archived.description: Indicates if the course is archived

auto_complete_on_visit.description: Indicates if an html section should be auto-completed when a learner visits it

auto_enroll_from_waitlist.description: Indicates if a learner on the waitlist should be automatically enrolled when a seat becomes available

credits.description: The number of credits earned upon course completion

custom_fields.description: A structure representing custom fields that contains zero or more key: value pairs

delete_history_on_unenroll.description: Indicates if the learner's history in the course should be deleted if they are unenrolled

display_in_catalog.description: Indicates if the course should appear in the course catalog

enrollment_open.description: Indicates if learners can currently enroll into the course

finish_at.description: When the course finishes (only applies to instructor-led and blended courses)

locked.description: Indicates if the course is locked

long_description.description: A long description of the course

max_seats.description: The maximum number of learners in the course, whether they are active or not

max_students.description: The maximum number of active learners in the course

language.description: The language associated with the resource.

must_repurchase_to_reenroll.description: Indicates if a learner must re-purchase the course in order to take it again

open_enrollment.description: Indicates if the course is public and allows enrollment from visitors

organization_id.description: The ID of the organization that the course belongs to

path.description: Indicates if the course is a learning path

picture.description: The URL of the course picture

price.description: The price of the course (when e-commerce is enabled)

private.description: Indicates if the course is private and needs an access code to join it

short_description.description: A short description of the course

sis_id.description: The unique SIS ID of the course

sis_pid.description: The unique SIS ID of the parent course

start_at.description: When the course starts (only applies to instructor-led and blended courses)

style.description: The style of course, which must be one of "Self paced", "Instructor", "Blended", or "Micro class"

tax_exempt.description: Indicates if the course is tax-exempt

time_zone.description: The time zone associated with the course

waitlist_after_limit.description: Indicates if an enrollment should automatically be placed onto the waitlist once the max-students limit has been reached

weight_using_categories.description: Indicates if assessments should be grouped by category when calculating weights

weights.description: The weighting setting, must be one of: 'MaxScore', 'Points', 'Percent', or 'Equally'

allow_unenrollment.description: Indicates if learners can un-enroll from the course

auto_complete_on_visit.description: Indicates if an html section should be auto-completed when a learner visits it

auto_enroll_from_waitlist.description: Indicates if a learner on the waitlist should be automatically enrolled when a seat becomes available

custom_fields.description: A structure representing custom fields that contains zero or more key: value pairs

delete_history_on_unenroll.description: Indicates if the learner's history in the course should be deleted if they are unenrolled

display_in_catalog.description: Indicates if the course should appear in the course catalog

enrollment_open.description: Indicates if learners can currently enroll into the course

finish_at.description: When the course finishes (only applies to instructor-led and blended courses)

locked.description: Indicates if the course is locked

long_description.description: A long description of the course

max_seats.description: The maximum number of learners in the course, whether they are active or not

max_students.description: The maximum number of active learners in the course

language.description: The language associated with the resource.

scope_id.description: The scope ID of the resource.

must_repurchase_to_reenroll.description: Indicates if a learner must re-purchase the course in order to take it again

open_enrollment.description: Indicates if the course is public and allows enrollment from visitors

organization_id.description: The ID of the organization that the course belongs to

path.description: Indicates if the course is a learning path

price.description: The price of the course (when e-commerce is enabled)

private.description: Indicates if the course is private and needs an access code to join it

short_description.description: A short description of the course

start_at.description: When the course starts (only applies to instructor-led and blended courses)

style.description: The style of course, which must be one of "Self paced", "Instructor", "Blended", or "Micro class"

tags.description: Tags associated with the course template

tax_exempt.description: Indicates if the course is tax-exempt

time_zone.description: The time zone associated with the course

waitlist_after_limit.description: Indicates if an enrollment should automatically be placed onto the waitlist once the max-students limit has been reached

weight_using_categories.description: Indicates if assessments should be grouped by category when calculating weights

weights.description: The weighting setting, must be one of: 'MaxScore', 'Points', 'Percent', or 'Equally'

post.description:
Create one or more copies of the specified course template.

Because this operation copies a course, which can take a while, it always operates in batch mode, and will return a batch ID that can be used to monitor the progress and get the final result of the operation.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the course_template

parameters.name: $options
parameters.description: Valid options are: deep_copy

requestBody.description: Here is the format of a request.

items.title: Course Template
items.description: A course template is a cookie-cutter from which teachable courses can be made. A course template can have instructors, but not learners or assistants.

allow_reenrollment.description: Indicates if learners can re-enroll into the course

allow_unenrollment.description: Indicates if learners can un-enroll from the course

auto_complete_on_visit.description: Indicates if an html section should be auto-completed when a learner visits it

auto_enroll_from_waitlist.description: Indicates if a learner on the waitlist should be automatically enrolled when a seat becomes available

custom_fields.description: A structure representing custom fields that contains zero or more key: value pairs

delete_history_on_unenroll.description: Indicates if the learner's history in the course should be deleted if they are unenrolled

display_in_catalog.description: Indicates if the course should appear in the course catalog

enrollment_open.description: Indicates if learners can currently enroll into the course

finish_at.description: When the course finishes (only applies to instructor-led and blended courses)

locked.description: Indicates if the course is locked

long_description.description: A long description of the course

max_seats.description: The maximum number of learners in the course, whether they are active or not

max_students.description: The maximum number of active learners in the course

language.description: The language associated with the resource.

scope_id.description: The scope ID of the resource.

must_repurchase_to_reenroll.description: Indicates if a learner must re-purchase the course in order to take it again

open_enrollment.description: Indicates if the course is public and allows enrollment from visitors

organization_id.description: The ID of the organization that the course belongs to

path.description: Indicates if the course is a learning path

price.description: The price of the course (when e-commerce is enabled)

private.description: Indicates if the course is private and needs an access code to join it

short_description.description: A short description of the course

start_at.description: When the course starts (only applies to instructor-led and blended courses)

style.description: The style of course, which must be one of "Self paced", "Instructor", "Blended", or "Micro class"

tags.description: Tags associated with the course template

tax_exempt.description: Indicates if the course is tax-exempt

time_zone.description: The time zone associated with the course

waitlist_after_limit.description: Indicates if an enrollment should automatically be placed onto the waitlist once the max-students limit has been reached

weight_using_categories.description: Indicates if assessments should be grouped by category when calculating weights

weights.description: The weighting setting, must be one of: 'MaxScore', 'Points', 'Percent', or 'Equally'

post.description:
Create an organization.

An optional position=setting option may be used to specify the location of the new organization. Here are the available options for the setting, and if a position is not specified, it is AtEnd by default:

AtStart
Added as the first organization
AtEnd
Added as the last organization
AfterOrg:ID
Added after the organization with the specified ID
BeforeOrg:ID
Added before the organization with the specified ID
FirstChildOfOrg:ID
Added as the first child of the organization with the specified ID
LastChildOfOrg:ID
Added as the last child of the organization with the specified ID

parameters.name: $options
parameters.description: Valid options are: position

requestBody.description: Here is the format of a request.

schema.title: Organization
schema.description: An organization represents a logical partitioning of users, courses, groups, and other items. Organizations can be structured into a hierarchy, and permissions can be granted to administrators so that they are able to administer an organization and all its sub-organizations.

custom_fields.description: A structure representing custom fields that contains zero or more key: value pairs.

description.example: Everyone who is a member of the marketing department

internal.description: Indicates if the organization is for internal use (i.e. employees) or external use (i.e. for customers)

parent_id.description: The ID of the parent of this organization, or nil if there is no parent

201.description: Here is the format of the response when the operation is a success.

post.description:
Create an organization that is a suborganizations of the specified organization.

An optional position=setting option may be used to specify the location of the new organization. Here are the available options for the setting, and if a position is not specified, it is LastChildOfOrg by default:

FirstChildOfOrg
Added as the first child of the organization
LastChildOfOrg
Added as the last child of the organization

schema.title: Organization
schema.description: An organization represents a logical partitioning of users, courses, groups, and other items. Organizations can be structured into a hierarchy, and permissions can be granted to administrators so that they are able to administer an organization and all its sub-organizations.

custom_fields.description: A structure representing custom fields that contains zero or more key: value pairs.

internal.description: Indicates if the organization is for internal use (i.e. employees) or external use (i.e. for customers)

parent_id.description: The ID of the parent of this organization, or nil if there is no parent

FirstChildOfOrg
Added as the first child of the organization
LastChildOfOrg
Added as the last child of the organization

Course.description: A course is the primary vehicle of delivery of educational content. A course can have instructors, learners, and assistants.

allow_unenrollment.description: Indicates if learners can un-enroll from the course

Game.title: Game
Game.description: A game has players, levels, and an optional leaderboard. Games are set up using automation rules to award points and badges to players when they achieve specific milestones such as completing a module, getting a good score on a quiz, or completing a course. You can have site-wide games, course games, group games, and path games. You can even organize players into teams that compete against each other.

description.example: Earn points and badges by demonstrating knowledge of marketing techniques

game_enabled.description: Indicate if the game is enabled

id.description: The unique ID of the game

user_id.description: The ID of the learner associated with this grade

city.description: The city in the user's address

country.description: The country in the user's address

custom_fields.description: A structure representing custom fields that contains zero or more key: value pairs.

email_sync.description: How messages should be sync'ed to email. Must be one of: 'None', 'All', 'Digest'

first_login_at.description: The time the user first logged in

first_name.description: The first name of the user

id.description: The unique ID of the user

instructorID.description: An instructor ID, which is generally used externally to the learning platform

job_title_id.description: The ID of the user's job title

job_title_name.description: The name of the user's job title

joined_at.description: The time the user joined the site

language.description: The language of the user

last_login_at.description: The time that the user last logged in

last_login_ip.description: The IP of the last login of the user

last_name.description: The last name of the user

learnerID.description: A learner ID, which is generally used externally to the learning platform

manager_id.description: The ID of the user's manager, if they have one

manager_name.description: The name of the user's manager, if they have one

mobile_phone.description: The mobile phone number of the user

organization_id.description: The ID of the user's organization

organization_name.description: The name of the organization that the user belongs to

phone.description: The phone number of the user

roles.description: The user's roles, which can be one or more of the following: Administrator, Affiliate, Instructor, Learner, Manager, Mentor, Monitor, Parent, Resource manager, and TA

sms_email.description: The email address used to send SMS messages

sms_sync.description: How messages should be sync'ed to SMS email. Must be one of: 'None', 'All'

state.description: The state in the user's address

street_1.description: The first street in the user's address

street_2.description: The second street in the user's address

street_3.description: The third street in the user's address

userid.description: The unique userid of the user

zip.description: The zip code in the user's address
